alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 11 at 3:06PM PST until December 14 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM SUNDAY TO 10 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 24 inches for communities along Highway 395, with 2 to 5 feet above 7000 feet. Totals along the Sierra Crest over 6 feet. Sierra ridge winds could exceed 100 mph with gusts 50-60 mph for wind prone locations along US-395. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 10 PM Sunday to 10 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage and power outages. Secure holiday decorations to prevent them from blowing away. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds are likely to be Sunday night through Monday. Snow will begin in the Sierra Sunday, expanding along the US-395 corridor east Sunday night into Monday morning.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
